title: English Language Arts: Grade 2
subject: English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards for English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

9921750B4A6C4E3396F41525D8094E38.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to
texts, including using adjectives and adverbs to describe (e.g., When other kids are happy that makes
me happy).

322433079B254059AE4C88257F3FB11A.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related verbs (e.g., toss, throw, hurl) and closely
related adjectives (e.g., thin, slender, skinny, scrawny).

7F1E29205B694734A7D366DB2FAC71FB.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe foods that are spicy or
juicy).

D64FAB20425343439A574122B5B9DED0.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

409E9B6FD93741599C6863761476F782.description:
Use reference materials (e.g., glossaries and beginning dictionaries) to determine or clarify the
meaning of words and phrases.

D1568E0A599B4A33A0DD8705A42DA91E.description:
Use a known root word to identify the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g.,
addition, additional).

B7292EDF75EC4FF2AC19ECCEC5FEDA1B.description:
Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known prefix is added to a known word
(e.g., happy/unhappy, tell/retell).

A56F8CEE7F124B6F9FAFAD5ED80B236F.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

BADD24E2D40D4417A6D5156EC1ACE981.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade
2 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

17E77C1085C64635B004249F9A35FB19.description: Compare formal and informal uses of English.

BA8DB36091D6473AA1895C46DB479C16.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

636AE5A2CF064166A07F34E265DF1C00.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., beginning dictionaries) as needed, to check and correct
spellings.

70FD09469D95421BBFEE43D3833DC1EA.description: Generalize learned spelling patterns when writing words (e.g., cage → badge; boy → boil).

A64A8B6A171E4D38868193607D710E1D.description: Use an apostrophe to form contractions and frequently occurring possessives.

D9FF1C3F4D2E42EF83AF7D9B3A1F87C7.description: Use commas in greetings and closings of letters.

6D5C01DE95B0496A872FCF9A63D9E46D.description: Capitalize holidays, product names, and geographic names.

A18F631D973642829419796F679DE895.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling
when writing.

D283A7D7977A42D69A68E959FB65422E.description:
Produce, expand, and rearrange complete simple and compound sentences (e.g., The boy
watched the movie; The little boy watched the movie; The action movie was watched by the little
boy).

30C5C8905EE5455EA7A268FD3ED73394.description: Form and use the past tense of frequently occurring irregular verbs (e.g., sat, hid, told).

C3A780D88587487D8FF17AD30C925357.description: Form and use frequently occurring irregular plural nouns (e.g., feet, children, teeth, mice, fish).

EB01A0292C2A441B8EC2EA9A0C9ECFA1.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.

15441DAADF114BA1840E172060DB897D.description:
Speak audibly and in complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide
requested detail or clarification when retelling familiar stories or reciting poems, nursery rhymes or lines
of a play. (See grade 2 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

0A70A1FB793846E8A77CCA25456FEA64.description:
Create audio recordings of stories or poems; add drawings or other visual displays to stories or
recounts of experiences when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

216BA721D9C744DEA913CF3226B1C939.description:
Recount an experience or tell a story with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking
clearly in complete sentences.

6CB73CC3442347A9BD54CDA7C2C626EE.description:
Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to clarify comprehension, gather
additional information, or deepen understanding of a topic or issue.

4A3C19B707734A46B45352D934080CE4.description:
Describe the main topic and recount key details from a text read aloud, information presented orally, or
other media.

D2B74A6012FF40F686A1B96084F9C271.description:
Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed about the topics and texts under
discussion.

1742D13F3B9D4DE0BF106D91D5304E87.description: Build on others’ talk in conversations by linking their comments to the remarks of others.

E991388B06924310BFED343FB5086CF5.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to
others, staying on topic, and taking turns speaking).

04A9F5F33A6F4BBB9C5BB39C9BC5599A.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with peers and adults about grade 2 topics and texts in both
small and larger groups.

A59D123DA6164F9D8FA53A9C2E40F476.description: Recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

5B0566115289400090898F0A0CA32675.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., read a number of books on a single topic to
produce a report; record science observations).

3A0319C904FF44CAA101E03C6C6BAA89.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

B6496CEF92A94BE1B206D00D6C239884.description:
With guidance and support from adults and collaboration with peers, use a variety of digital tools to
produce and publish writing.

FB6740CC51924F3885EBE86A92164EB6.description:
With guidance and support from adults and peers, focus on a topic and strengthen writing as needed by
revising and editing.

39826441FE524561B0E3C305EC4D67EF.description:
Write narratives in which they recount a well-elaborated event or short sequence of events, include
details to describe actions, thoughts, and feelings, use temporal words to signal event order, and
provide a sense of closure.

861D1CA29007410994B77E54EE282305.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts in which they introduce a topic, use facts and definitions to develop
points, and provide a concluding statement or section.

65B153E44241461BB84CA88FE498A49D.description:
Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or book they are writing about, state an opinion,
supply reasons that support the opinion, use linking words (e.g., because, and, also) to connect opinion
and reasons, and provide a concluding statement or section.

C70F8489211F4E8794C307689884B4E0.description: Produce manuscript writing with accuracy and automaticity.

FCCBC7E2E4A64A1BACD566631CD029FE.description: Print independently and legibly for a variety of tasks and purposes.

CB9E2252BB504698B6AF104204B4C65F.description:
Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive
readings.

0F496C62B7CC4CB98FC6CB4F84786E2C.description: Use decoding skills to self-correct word recognition, rereading as necessary.

31ACBD04B2444D59AE7E0C6EB71F5F3B.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

A758FFE1E746408BA2C012013472E91B.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension

6B2A689930214CF6BEA83A31B3131B46.description: Read grade-appropriate high frequency words with accuracy and automaticity.

AD0ADAADB14748448B6C3BD017ED2C37.description: With prompting and support, decode and encode words with inconsistent but common spelling-sound correspondences.

54B00737F397442F9F7A9CC936C6E17C.description: Decode and encode words with common prefixes and suffixes.

30DC0CEAA87C469CBAE2CCA3AAD4ABE4.description: Decode and encode regularly spelled two-syllable or multisyllabic words.

99DAF748BF094E579662BA2E5E43753D.description:
Decode and encode common vowel teams. With prompting and support, decode and encode
additional vowel teams.

CECD06DC9A5F469A9BC96375365367F4.description: Decode and encode long and short vowels in regularly-spelled one-syllable words.

1D693004ECE842EF819C6C1F1C9EAD77.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to support decoding and encoding words.

0754D2B6F0E44A05827E382EC1E3F1C4.description: Reading and Writing Standards: Foundational Skills

021B1A58119E4F49A8CC8085A164650A.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies,
science, and technical texts, in the grades 2–3 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as
needed at the high end of the range.

5250E93CE0014F278FDFE8606800C99E.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

15A88F09455A4C688EAEC6062B94128D.description: Compare and contrast the most important points presented by two texts on the same topic.

FA23980CA4424586A9977B0A7B970261.description: Describe how reasons support specific points the author makes in a text.

0BD420C4802F4F16B68CEDA4C44DD098.description:
Explain how specific images (e.g., a diagram showing how a machine works) and details contribute to
and clarify a text.

1F37E845F68847728B223F7F0BF8D1EE.description: Identify the main purpose of a text, including the author’s point of view and/or perspective.

0FBC31C038A14264BA9CB840FDDFB918.description:
Know and use various text features (e.g., captions, bold print, subheadings, glossaries, indexes,
electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text efficiently.

A4434D97AD5A4E1DB4525B01303BF7A9.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 2 topic or subject area.

B86CE29B48AF44609714506CEC2141C4.description:
Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in
technical procedures in a text.

EE8D6B408BD747C482FB4AD1EFE2074E.description:
Identify the main topic of a multi-paragraph text as well as the focus of specific paragraphs within the
text.

378C12B26DBF4864A13F4112D7885DAF.description:
Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate
understanding of key details in a text.

AAFAB33BDBB04BC5BEA1A23E79B89A42.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories and poetry, in the grades 2-3
text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

E19D3C45D5D34E48AA626F3F08A3D94F.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

45EF1707D2F1406B8B025896C18FDFE8.description:
Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same story by different authors or from different
cultures.

DE91B967D42B4E78806C56CB140A880B.description:
Use information gained from the illustrations and words in a story to demonstrate understanding of its
characters, setting, or plot.

E6B2D9A263D74139BEB683130B8EBF77.description:
Acknowledge differences in the points of view (perspective) of characters, including by speaking in a
different voice for each character when reading dialogue aloud.

39771371ED7144AA9C6156ED94BA6F7F.description:
Describe the overall structure of a story, including describing how the beginning introduces the story,
how the middle progresses the plot, and how the ending concludes the action.

E6A0F791830343C1B20AFD67545AA51F.description:
Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, repeated lines) supply
rhythm and meaning in a story, poem, or song.

297AF74433004437BE4F66CB2D269108.description: Describe how characters in a story respond to major events and challenges, drawing on key details.

5D661683FD7E4864AE90FFF8CE7FDCBA.description:
Recount and determine the central message, lesson or moral of stories, including but not limited to
fables and folktales from diverse cultures.

084F18A3122A4987965AF1FCB2915F5E.description:
Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate
understanding of key details using evidence from the text.
